messages.title: A personal message from Claire HISCOTT
messages.content: Living in Redland and being an adopted Bristolian for over 17 years I love our city and the vibrancy of our culture and heritage. I have been committed to improving life for residents in my work as a community pharmacist and as a job, a volunteer for many charities and organizations. I believe that if you want to see change you have to get on and do something wherever and whenever you are able.

messages.title: Education is a Priority!
messages.content: As a mother, who has brought up my two teenage children in Redland I understand how vital education is. We need to make sure that every child, no matter what their background, has the best start in life.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Job - vital places secured. Benefits - The extra £10 for 136,000 workers. Tax - and tax cuts to 22 million.

Working to ensure accessible apprenticeships and promote vocational courses. Protect priorities to make more accessible. Over the past 5 years, we have created 2 million new apprenticeships with 23% applying the country-wide in B'Ness & the Professions.

issues.environment: Our city's population is growing and needs a robust plan to expand. Affordable housing is essential to make more people self-sufficient and ensure security.

housing.content: Our city's population is growing and needs a robust plan to expand. Affordable housing is essential to make more people self-sufficient and ensure security.

politicalExperience.achievements: Medicine reviews and continuing success as a school governor.

images.caption: Claire HISCOTT Working for a Better Bristol. Fighting for a Better Britain.
